title: Sinner beats Alcaraz to defend ATP Finals crown
byline: Jannik Sinner signed off his 2025 season in style by overcoming world number one Carlos Alcaraz in two tight sets to defend his ATP Finals crown in Turin.

title: Pakistan Crush Sri Lanka 3–0 After Six-Wicket Win in Rawalpindi
byline: Pakistan wrapped up a dominant ODI series with a six-wicket victory in Rawalpindi, completing a 3–0 whitewash on Sunday. Captain Shaheen Afridi hailed his team’s “discipline and depth” as Pakistan continued their strong run with another all-round display.

title: Former Deputy Speaker appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Deputy Speaker Ajith Rajapaksa appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption this morning.

title: Govt tightens tourist safety measures as peak season begins
byline: As Sri Lanka enters its peak tourism season, the government has issued strict directives to police and relevant authorities to ensure the safety and wellbeing of foreign visitors, the Daily Mirror learns. The move comes as the country anticipates over two million tourist arrivals by the end of 2025.

title: Sri Lanka’s greatest threat to tourism is us!
byline: Last week, Sri Lanka went viral and sadly, for all the wrong reasons. A friend sent me a video that was spreading rapidly on Instagram. It showed a female tourist driving a tuk-tuk in the Arugam Bay area, filming herself, most likely for TikTok. Minutes into her ride, she said she was being followed by a local man on a motorbike. When she pulled over, he stopped too and walked right up to her while the camera was still rolling.

title: Reform’s Zia Yusuf in heated clash with presenter over parents migration from Sri Lanka
byline: Reform’s head of policy, Zia Yusuf, clashed with a Sky News presenter during a debate on immigration, after being asked about his parents’ decision to move to the UK from Sri Lanka in the 1980s.

title: International group defrauds Sri Lanka Postal customers of foreign currency
byline: The Sri Lanka Postal Department has revealed that an international organization has been defrauding postal customers of foreign currency for over two years, exploiting the Department’s name to carry out financial scams.

title: Political conspiracy behind return of Thai-gifted elephants, says minister
byline: Environment Minister Dr. Dhammika Patabendi has alleged a political conspiracy behind the proposed return of two elephants gifted to Sri Lanka by Thailand.

title: Patients hit hard by shortage of antibiotics and testing facilities – Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa
byline: Patients in major hospitals are facing serious difficulties due to a shortage of strong antibiotics, laboratory chemicals, and radiological testing facilities, Chairman of the Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance for Medical and Civil Rights Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: Asia New Zealand Foundation visit boosts Sri Lanka–New Zealand ties
byline: The Asia New Zealand Foundation, a non-partisan not-for-profit organisation, is New Zealand’s leading provider of Asia-focused insights and experiences. Recognising Asia’s growing importance to the future of New Zealand’s prosperity, the Foundation works to build understanding and capability so that New Zealanders can engage confidently and meaningfully in Asia.

title: Thousands to be affected as health services come to a standstill
byline: With the key medical professional body declaring a trade union action from today (17), the patients are once again held to ransom, leaving them to face the fallout of stalled services.

title: Colombo High Court indicts Keheliya Rambukwella and family
byline: Indictments have been served before Colombo High Court Judge Mohamed Mihal against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his son Ramith Rambukwella, his daughter Amali Nayanika Rambukwella, and their housemaid Nipunie Krishnajina in connection with two cases filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Over 1,100 arrested in “Ratama Ekata” raids
byline: Another 1,123 suspects have been arrested in raids carried out under the national operation “Ratam Ekata,” the Police said.

title: Australian Paralympic gold medallist dies at 28
byline: Australian Paralympic gold medallist Paige Greco has died at the age of 28.

title: SJB PS member arrested with 86g of cannabis
byline: A member of the Kandaketiya Pradeshiya Sabha representing the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has been arrested in Pallewatte for possession of 86 grams of cannabis.

title: Ahead of Hasina court verdict, son warns of Bangladesh violence if party ban stays
byline: The son and adviser of ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said on Sunday that supporters of her Awami League would block February’s national election if a ban on the party was not lifted, warning that protests could escalate into violence.

title: Sri Lanka has signed 70 MOUs with various countries: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka has signed 70 MOUs with various countries within the first year of the present government’s tenure, Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Hearth told Parliament today.

title: Male-dominant HIV cases continue to rise
byline: Sri Lanka is witnessing a trend of male-dominant HIV infections, with the majority of newly reported cases in 2025 being among men, according to the latest data from the National STD/AIDS Control Programme.

title: Drug addicts will not be arrested and imprisoned: Minister
byline: Claiming that the government was not expecting to arrest and imprison drug addicts, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala yesterday urged parents and guardians of drug addicts to intervene to send them for rehabilitation voluntarily.

title: Buddha statue of Sambuddha Jayanthi Vihara Trincomalee was removed for safety: Minister
byline: The Buddha statue of the Sambuddha Jayanthi Vihara in Trincomalee was removed last night for safety, but will be re-erected today, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: From Dh100 to Dh100K and eyeing Dh100m: Sri Lankan expat lives the UAE Lottery dream
byline: A Sri Lankan expat has gone from a casual Dh100 win to pocketing a whopping Dh100,000, and now he’s daring to dream even bigger – the Dh100 million jackpot.

title: Seven individuals stabbed by psychiatric patient
byline: At least seven individuals had received stab injuries during a confrontation with a psychiatric patient during an alms giving at a house in Medadumbara area off Kandy yesterday.The psychiatric patient was one of the occupants of the house. Police said two women and five men had received stab injuries and admitted to the Kandy National Hospital.

title: Former Geology and Mines Bureau Chairman arrested
byline: Former Chairman of the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB), Anura Walpola, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Israel rejects US-backed push for “pathway” to Palestinian state
byline: Jerusalem on Sunday rejected a joint statement coordinated by the United States and signed by several countries, which called for a “pathway” – a possible route – to Palestinian self-determination and statehood. Several Israeli cabinet members emphasized that Israel would not permit a Palestinian state in either Judea and Samaria or the Gaza Strip.

title: New Bill aimed at countering terrorism will be out soon: Minister
byline: A new Bill aimed at countering terrorism will be out for public consultation soon, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector hits new high as visitor arrivals cross 2 million
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism industry continues its robust recovery, surpassing the 2 million foreign visitor mark in 2025. The milestone was celebrated with the arrival of French tourists Raphael Caron and his wife Claire Charlet at Katunayake Airport today.

title: 21-year-old woman found dead near Ratnapura dam
byline: The body of a 21-year-old woman was discovered floating near the dam of a small hydroelectric power plant in the Rathgama Water Canal, within the Wewelwatte Police Division, Ratnapura.

title: ITAK calls for Tamil NPP members to resign over Trincomalee statue controversy
byline: The Illankai Tamil Arasu Katchi (ITAK) has demanded the immediate resignation of all Tamil members of the National People’s Power (NPP), including Trincomalee District MP and Deputy Foreign Minister Arun Hemachandra, following the government’s handling of a Buddha statue installation in Trincomalee.

title: Kumar Sangakkara replaces Rahul Dravid as Rajasthan Royals head coach for IPL 2026
byline: Former Sri Lanka captain and wicketkeeper-batter Kumar Sangakkara will now hold a dual responsibility at the Rajasthan Royals after being appointed as the franchise’s head coach for the upcoming edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2026.

title: Ousted Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina sentenced to death
byline: Bangladesh’s deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in abstentia by a court in Dhaka for crimes against humanity over a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.

title: SLFP suspends members who backed NPP budgets
byline: The Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP) said it would take strict disciplinary action against party members who supported the National People’s Power (NPP) during recent budget approvals in local government bodies.

title: Indian pilgrims’ bus crashes in Saudi Arabia; 45 killed, says Hyderabad top cop
byline: At least 45 people were charred to death after a bus carrying Umrah pilgrims collided with a diesel tanker near Madinah, according to local media in Saudi Arabia on Monday. The victims are believed to be Indian nationals, with several reportedly from Hyderabad.

title: Bangladesh’s ousted PM Hasina convicted in students crackdown case
byline: A Bangladesh court convicted ousted Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina of crimes against humanity on Monday, concluding a months-long trial that found her guilty of ordering a deadly crackdown on a student-led uprising last year.

title: Former Geological Survey Chief granted bail
byline: Anura Walpola, former Chairman of the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau, has been granted bail in connection with his alleged unlawful recruitment of K. Dulani Anupama as Assistant Director in 2020.

title: All detained BYD vehicles released, Court of Appeal informed
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs (SLC) today informed the Court of Appeal that all BYD vehicles previously detained by the Department have now been released, in line with the agreement reached between the parties at the earlier hearing.

title: Dasun Shanaka to lead Sri Lanka for Pakistan tri-series
byline: Sri Lanka will field a side under the leadership of Dasun Shanaka for the upcoming tri-nation series in Pakistan, after captain Charith Asalanka and fast bowler Asitha Fernando were ruled out due to illness.

title: Joshua to fight YouTube star Paul in December
byline: Former world heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua will fight YouTube star Jake Paul in a professional bout on 19 December.

title: Bangladesh urges India to extradite Sheikh Hasina, aide
byline: Bangladesh’s interim government on Monday urged India to immediately extradite deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina and her former home minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal, hours after a special tribunal sentenced them to death in absentia for ’’crimes against humanity’’.

title: Government to introduce stable price for big onions
byline: The government has decided to introduce a stable price for big onions in a manner that is fair to farmers, President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Delhi’s alleged car bomb attacker named by investigators
byline: Indian investigators have named the man who they claim was driving the car that blew up last Monday near the landmark Red Fort monument in capital Delhi.

title: Market starts the week on a weak note amid profit-taking and high volatility
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange opened the week on a negative footing on Monday (17th November 2025), as both benchmark indices declined sharply, weighed down by profit-taking following the conclusion of the earnings season and heightened intraday volatility.

title: NMRA announces controlled prices for 350 medicines to benefit patients
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) today announced controlled prices for 350 types of medicines, aiming to make essential treatments more affordable for the public.

title: TU action by GMOA continues as talks fail
byline: The trade union action launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) continues, with discussions held with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake failing to produce a satisfactory outcome.

title: 'More relief than euphoria' - Norway end long wait
byline: For the first time in a generation Norway fans will experience the joy of supporting their team at an international tournament.

title: Sri Lanka could have reached 3 million tourist arrivals, if BIA terminal had been expanded: Deputy Minister
byline: Claiming that some 30 to 40 Winter Charter flights have to be cancelled within a week due to the delay in expansion of the passenger terminal at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Deputy Minister of Tourism Ruwan Ranasinghe said today if those flights could have been accommodated, Sri Lanka could have reached the target of 3 million tourist arrivals this year.

title: Sri Lanka still to come to agreement with U.S. on reciprocal tariffs: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka is yet to reach any final agreement to be inked with the United States on reciprocal tariffs, and discussions are still underway regarding the matter, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath said today.

title: Woman killed in shooting at Meetiyagoda
byline: A woman was killed in a shooting incident reported at Dombanwila in Meetiyagoda today, Police said.

title: Air India to resume flights to China after nearly six years
byline: Air India said on Monday it will resume New Delhi-China flights starting February 2026, nearly six years after suspension, as recent diplomatic steps are seen as cautiously reopening bilateral links.

title: Sri Lanka gets USD 300 million support from ADB
byline: Sri Lanka has signed loan agreements with the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to receive USD 300 million. The funds will support three main programs to strengthen the financial sector, improve the economy, and develop tourism.

title: Police have violated the Constitution: Amarapura Nikaya Mahanayaka Thera
byline: Mahanayaka Thera of the Amarapura Chapter, Most Venerable Karagoda Uyangoda Maithrimurthi Thera, in a letter addressed to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, has expressed his dismay at the incident at the Bodhiraja Sambuddha Jayanthi Viharaya in Trincomalee.

title: 1938 toll-free Women’s Helpline receives 2,182 complaints on violence against women
byline: A total of 2,182 complaints related to violence against women have been reported from November 2024 to October this year through the 1938 toll-free Women’s Helpline operated by the National Committee on Women (NCW) under the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs.

title: President assures GMOA’s proposals, requests will be considered in due course
byline: A discussion between the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) and President Anura Kumara Dissanayake was held this morning at the Presidential Secretariat where the President noted that the proposals and requests presented by the Government Medical Officers’ Association will be considered in due course.
